headline: Chef John's Macaroni and Cheese
description: This panko mac and cheese is Chef John's easy-to-make, old-fashioned casserole with a crisp, buttery breadcrumb topping and a gooey, cheesy center.

video.description: See how to make Thomas Jefferson’s favorite comfort food.
video.name: Chef John’s Macaroni and Cheese

name: Chef John's Macaroni and Cheese
recipeIngredient: 3 cups shredded sharp Cheddar cheese, divided

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook elbow macaroni in the boiling water, stirring occasionally, until tender yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes. Drain and set aside.
Melt 1/4 cup butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. When butter starts to foam and bubble, stir in flour; cook on medium heat until flour begins to turn pale yellow, 3 to 4 minutes.
Add thyme, cayenne, and white pepper; cook and stir another minute, then whisk in 1 cup milk until smooth. Pour in remaining milk and whisk again. Bring sauce just to a simmer.
Stir in salt, Worcestershire sauce, and nutmeg. Simmer, whisking often, on medium-low heat until thickened, about 8 minutes.
Turn heat off, then add 2 1/4 cups Cheddar cheese; stir until melted and combined. Mix in Dijon mustard.
Transfer macaroni into a casserole dish, then pour in cheese sauce; stir to thoroughly combine pasta with sauce.
Mix together panko bread crumbs and 1 tablespoon melted butter in a small bowl.
Sprinkle mixture over macaroni and cheese. Sprinkle remaining 3/4 cup Cheddar cheese on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until top is golden brown, about 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Omitted Thyme, didn't have any, nor white pepper so just used a pinch of black ground pepper. Delish!

It was good, I decided to 1.5x the sauce after reading reviews indicating it was dry, so I think that saved it. There was a bit of a weird zing to it, but it could be that my pepper is a little "extra". Everyone ate it, but they asked if we could keep looking for a different recipe to try next time we feel like homemade mac.
Definitely thought this was a great recipe for a more high-end mac 'n cheese. Overall, I think I prefer a more creamy, less "sharp" cheese sauce.

I thought this was just "okay". Not much flavor. I halved the recipe, using 6 oz. elbow macaroni. After tasting the white sauce, I added more Dijon and Worcestershire sauce, before adding the cheese. I found it to be drier than I like, even though I cut back on the elbows, and it just didn't have much of a taste. I usually like Chef John recipes, but I didn't care for this one.

I loved this mac and cheese. After making the cheese sauce I took a taste and adjusted the spices to my liking. I added a bit more white pepper. for those who thought it was bland, this is the time to spice it up your way. As suggested I doubled the topping. Simply wonderful.
Very little cheese flavor and dry noodles. Even with grating extra cheddar on the individual portions, everyone at the table was disappointed.
too much cayenne
I can always count on Chef John’s recipes to deliver. The only changes I made were to cut the recipe in half and to use cheddar jack cheese. I loved the crunch of the panko on top. Delicious!
I add ham steak cubed and jalapeño rings and sun dried tomatoes diced up to make an excellent addition. My whole family loves it. I use buttered crushed cheese-itz instead of panko crumbs.

This mac and cheese recipe combines a great texture from the crust and a very creamy interior. It was relatively quick and easy to make. The flavor was good but I needed to add more salt to taste as I hadn't seasoned my pasta water enough. I would probably cut back on the nutmeg and add a little more heat. I should have left it in the oven a little longer or hit it with the broiler in the end to darken the topping a little. This recipe provides a great base to add lots of different flavors or additions. Thanks Chef John!
Followed the recipe to the letter. Hate to say it was very bland with little to no cheese flavor. I put extra cheese and still little flavor.
The extra flavor ingredients were interesting, but subtle. Might bump them up next time. Very good recipe!
Thank you Chef John !! Best Mac&Cheese. I added garlic to step 3, my husband love it. Thank you for making me a good cook.

Very good. I did use a 12 oz. can of evaporated milk for part of the 3 c of milk called for and although I made 16 oz. of pasta, chose to use about 12 oz instead. No other modifications. Three of the seven family members had 2 servings, so that's a hit in my book.

I made this for a family get together and I have to say I was fairly disappointed. I followed the recipe exactly but it was dry and sticky, not the way any one in my family likes their mac and cheese. I probably won't make again as I have other recipes that are more to our liking. I tried this one because generally I like Chef John's recipes. Sorry, this one is not going in my recipe box.
My favorite recipe! I make it all the time, following the recipe closely as often as I can and even when I don't, it still turns out delicious!

Love, love, love this recipe. Am I the only one for whom it takes much longer than 8 minutes to thicken? It’s worth the wait however! Only tweak I have made through the years is reducing, even sometimes eliminating the thyme. I personally find it overpowering. I also like to make large batches and freeze a meal or two for later :) Thanks chef John
Delicious! I make it frequently. A+++

I hadn't made mac & cheese for years, and happy to find a good recipe. I did add half a minced onion to the butter, cause I always did, and adjusted seasonings to taste. Someone had posted to add and wisk in cheese in small amounts which was a very helpful tip!

Chef John I give you 5 stars for this one. The only ingredient I changed was to american cheese (more kid friendly)and I left out the salt because there was enough in the cheese. My kids could not get enough of it and it reheats very good. Thanks for sharing your recipe. Updated review: I have used this recipe for over 10 years now and its the most requested by my kids, their friends and family. So easy to make and just so darn good. They had me write out a recipe card for their family cook books and yes I gave the credit to Chef John.*****STILL AMAZING AFTER ALL THESE YEARS*****
A little too spicy hot for my taste. Next time I will use half the amount of peppers.
This recipe is great! We added more of the spices and stirred in some andouille for a little heat. Chef John recipes are always thoughtful and delicious.
I added @ 4 tblsp marinara sauce and 1/2 cup sautéed chopped onion

I love this recipe and follow it pretty closely. I always have a variety of cheeses on hand so mix it up with Fontina, Gruyere, Cheddar and a bit of Parmesan. I always add tomato slices to the top as I love them. Delicious. Make the whole recipe and freeze several servings for a quick, delicious dinner with no work...
Absolutely worth the effort. Very tasty. My wife calls it crackaroni and cheese it is so addictive.
an easy dish to make and very tasty
Many years ago I wanted to try to make homemade Mac and cheese. This was the first recipe I tried and I’ve been making it ever since! It’s a family favorite and I make it at least once a month.

Have been using this recipe for years. It is a family favorite. I substitute oregano for the thyme and use crushed Ritz crackers for the topping. Also use up any cheeses that I have on hand such as Mozzarella, Parmesan, along with the Cheddar.
This is hands-down the best macaroni and cheese I have ever had. My husband loves it as well, especially the little hit of heat from the Cayenne pepper. :D
This was the first mac-n-cheese I ever made. Now when we have a gathering I have to bring the mac-n-cheese. The only change I made was I didn't put it in the oven

2016 - Oh so delicious! I think it's pretty hard to mess up homemade mac and cheese, but this definitely was a notch above the usual. I watched the video and he puts the cheese layer under the panko, but the recipe says to put it on top. I will definitely follow the video instructions every time. I'm not sure how the bread crumbs would have crisped if they were under cheese. I followed the recipe exactly and it feeds a TON of people. I would say it easily makes 12-15 servings if used as a side dish. The seasonings were perfect, just enough heat from the cayenne and the rest blends beautifully. I thought it was plenty cheesy with the full box of pasta. Also in the video he suggests using some Gouda cheese with it, will try that next time. Definitely a keeper! 4/11/22 update - I still use this several times a year. If it's a main dish, I've added ham and broccoli mixed in with the pasta and sauce.

This is definitely a great mac n cheese recipe. I think the thyme was a bit overpowering but still delicious. Next time I make it I am going to cut back on the thyme and use less macaroni to make it a bit more cheesy (which is just personal preference). Otherwise, I really enjoyed it!
I've tried many different mac & cheese recipes. This is my fave

I made this for my family and none of the kids would eat it because there were way too many spices. I didnt even like it myself because of the spice. And I made it according to the recipe and it had way too much sauce.
Always my go-to for holidays and everyone LOVES it. Seriously so addicting, cheesy, delicious, everything…..
Delicious! I put it into 2 8x8 dishes so I could freeze one.
Great recipe minus the bread crumbs. I've made this several times. I have to stop myself from continuous tasting that just turns in to eating before baking
I made this exactly as written and we all thought it was very bland and dry. Would not make this again.
Fast and delicious
Delicious! I've used many different mac & cheese recipes and this is a good one. It'a simple recipe just the way it is and/or you can substitute with a different variety of cheese or seasonings.
delicious my family favourite
The nutmeg and Worstershire sauce give the dish a nice kick. I was hoping the dish would be a little more cheesy. Overall, it was tasty and I'd make it again with some slight adjustments.
This is a very good recipe but there is way too much thyme. My daughter, who loves Mac and cheese, wouldn’t eat this. I’ll definitely try it again though.
This was easy to make and we all liked it!

I made this exactly as the recipe specified. My rue came out perfect. I took the rue off the heat and added the cheese stirring as I added. And then… the sauce turned grainy and it was awful. I don’t know why it didn’t work. Was it the cheese. I used cracker barrel extra sharp cheddar. Any advice would be welcome.

This was ok but I don’t know….. I feel like all I could taste was the cayenne pepper and white pepper. If I make this again I think I’d cut them out and maybe use something other then the mild cheddar that I used. Also, it was a bit dry. I think I’d add a whole cup more milk.
Delicious
Was very good. I did have to add some salt though.
Meh! It was very bland. I made again and added some tomato soup and green peppers. Much better!
One of the best here. My teenage boys love it and so do I. I added a little extra white pepper, but that’s about it as far as changes go.

I made it without any change, doubled everything, used black pepper as I didn’t have white. Put in deep 13x9 dish. Twice deeper than regular Pyrex. It is for tonight. Giving 5 stars already as the cheese sauce was delicious. One tip, if you are doubling, use a huge opt to make mixing easier. Takes longer than it says to setup as you have to find things, at least in my case it was ready to go to over in about an hour.
My whole family loves this recipe. I follow the recipe exactly except I skip the cayenne pepper and I add some pre-cooked ground Italian sausage. Delicious!
This is my go to mac n cheese. My family and I love it and our 6 year old grandson asks for it! Great flavor Chef John.
Super win with the whole family. I cooked the recipe as is.

This made a great Mac and Cheese dish. I used all ingredients, but upped the anti on some. 1 stick butter, 1/2 cup flour, 4 cups milk, and 4 cups cheese. I had these cheeses on hand and used them all to make 4 cups:. cheddar, Colby, parmesan, and Kraft slices. The combo is amazing. My husband doesn't like a crispy topping on his Mac and Cheese, so had to leave it out. I was reading from other reviewers that's the best part! Thanks to you Chef John, I now have a bonifide go to Mac and Cheese stupendous recipe. You're the best.
It turned out great! It was very easy to make and I loved the fact that it was much lighter than most recipes. Chef John has been a huge helping hand now that I eat out less.
The best macaroni and cheese ever!!

I really liked the consistency of this. I followed the directions except I didn’t have any thyme. I only gave it 4 stars b/c it was a bit more bland than I would have liked but an easy fix for next time. Overall, it was very creamy and cheesy. Definitely a new family favorite.
Love this recipe!! Just made a couple changes to fit our taste. Took out the nutmeg, thyme, cayenne pepper. And doubles the crumb mixture. Delicious..
This was good, not great, in my opinion. Better as a side dish instead of the main course.

Be made this recipe for every special occasion for the past 6 years and it’s always quite popular, I’ve even taught my daughter how to make it because she wanted to learn. This has become a family mainstay.

Chef John recipes are a favorite in our family, and this one didn't disappoint. " good" is the highest rating at our house, and this earned it.

Followed the recipe but cut back on pasta a bit and added onion powder, garlic powder, and smoked paprika. I think a fine, aged cheddar freshly shredded helps. The nutmeg was great! I didn't have milk, so I subbed half heavy cream and half almond milk. Added a small bag of frozen broccoli at the last two minutes of boiling pasta, and added a large can (drained) of chicken breast while mixing it all together. Next time, I'll up the broccoli and chicken.
I used gluten free flour and macaroni--otherwise made as written--and it was great!
Excellent recipe, puts a subtle flavor twist on the classic without changing the basic flavors!

Followed the directions with the exception of adding parmigiana because I didn’t have a full three cups of cheddar. It turned out great! Will definitely make again and incorporate some suggestions in video. I agree with some comments about reducing pasta if you like it to be more “saucy” ... but we like it just like it is.
I made the recipe as written with the addition of chicken to the sauce before mixing with the pasta. Very good comfort food. This is a keeper
I thought it was good however I prefer creamier and softer mac and cheese but this had good flavor.
I made this per the recipe. First time I made mac and cheese in years. We loved it. Next time I'll reduce the amount of macaroni as others have done.

First time making this with the only modification being we used 13 ounces of pasta vs 16oz and let the pasta cool a bit before adding the sauce, hoping to assure the moistness factor. The spices were right on for us, used the full amount of white pepper and cayenne as well as all the others exactly as written. Perfect! Only took 15 minutes in my oven to brown. Mmmmmm
It was delicious!!!!!!
I always like to make a recipe as written the first time. With 16oz of pasta, this was dry. I will try again with 8 oz.
I cook quite a bit. This Mac n cheese lacked flavor.

I made this on Christmas and it was a huge hit. It wasn’t dry at all like other recipes I’ve made before that go in the oven. I’ve made several recipes from Chef John and have been pleased with them all so far. Will definitely be making again.
I liked, but for our taste needed a bit more sauciness. That said, the nutmeg and cayenne were fantastic for flavor.
First off, I’ve never made Mac & cheese before but I’ve had plenty of it made by others. I enjoyed the finished product but my family wanted more cheese.
This is great! My whole family loved it! I halved the recipe and it was enough for us. We followed the recipe exactly, only forgot the mustard, and it is perfect! Thank you, Chef John!!

My family is gluten and dairy free so we have to alter it but it still turned out great. My teen kids and I appreciate the short fun videos that make cooking very achievable. Because we have to alter due to allergies and Chef John always saying you can change ingredients and play with it, I can see confidence growing with each new meal they try. 
Thank you Chef John

I'm giving a 3-star rating.
For me, this is a 2-star recipe. It tasted too much like it came out of a box mix for my preferences (has a weird tang to it... perhaps because of the Worcestershire?)
For my spouse and kids, it's a 4-star recipe.

This is the best mac and cheese I've ever made. A few minor tweaks to suit my taste (a little more cheese in the sauce and a little more butter in the bread crumbs as I used regular crumbs). I also added some home canned steelhead on top of the mac and sauce before putting the crumb and cheese topping on. My family couldn't get enough.
Fantastic. I added just a tad of fresh grated parmesan to the mix before baking. I will make this again
This was a great recipe.
Yummy
I split the cheese between sharp and mild cheddar. The roux came out perfectly. However, the final product was dry. I don't know if the answer is to use less pasta or add more milk.
It was wonderful! I added 1 chopped and sauteed onion at the beginning of step 4. Came out great!

I errored and failed to add the mustard to the sauce but it was still the one of the best mac-n-cheese dishes ever. A hit with the whole family and they want me to bring it again next time. I'll definitely do it again and try the complete "Tommy J's" mac-n-cheese recipe. Kudos to Chef John and our third president. GM
I've never made homemade Mac n cheese before , so after trying this recipe I will be making more often. This was so good.

I hate giving it two stars because mine was probably due to operator error but it came out super bland I followed the directions to a T and at first the cheese sauce looked amazingly creamy and the perfect color. I added to the pasta and baked it - it became thick and clotted kind of? Like it lost all the creamy texture it had at first.
Really good. Husband thought it would have been better without the cayenne.

Have made this many times now. Increase sauce recipe by ½ and use much more topping. I make this in a huge pan to increase surface area for the topping; we use the large rectangle pan part of an electric skillet and bake in oven.
Insanely perfect! Thanks Chef John for another amazing recipe! I didn’t have a fresh nutmeg however the ground nutmeg worked (Obvi).

This is the first 3-star review I have ever given a Chef John recipe. While I scoffed at the other complaints about the 1/4 t of thyme being too strong, I have to admit, it was too strong. Overall, the taste was ok. But, certainly not my fav of all of the wonderful Chef John entries.

This recipe was just okay. I decided to follow it exactly despite some of the reviews that adjusted the recipe. I thought the taste was good but my bf thought it was a little bland. Most of us agreed that it was also too dry. A lot of the other reviews doubled the wet ingredients or decreased the amount of macaroni and I would suggest following some of those.
It was awesome
I have made this several times, and find that it works best if I make 1.5 times the sauce. I also substitute half of the milk with cream, and broil rather than bake, as baking dries out the sauce.
this was terrific!

I made this recipe exactly as written and it turned out great. I have always fooled myself into thinking that other more complicated and more expensive Mac & Cheese recipes using a variety of artisanal cheeses were much better. Not so. This stands up to all those fancy ones in both taste and simplicity of preparation and is now my go to for Mac & Cheese. Thanks Chef John.
This Mac and Cheese was very satisfying. Was a crowd pleaser as a side to our meal. Will be making this one again!
I doubled the panko and the butter. Also I sprayed non-stick spray on casserole dish before dumping this wonderful concoction into it. Highly recommend
This is so.... delicious! And easy
